steps.title: Sketch two round circles:
steps.content: Sketch two round circles: a bigger one on the bottom and a smaller one on the top. They should both be overlapping each other. Make the circles as plump as you can. The more plump the more realistic it looks.

steps.title: Draw a parallel line on each side of the two circles.
steps.content: Draw a parallel line on each side of the two circles. This line should connect the two circles creating a full avocado base.

steps.title: Erase all the excess circles and lines.
steps.content: Erase all the excess circles and lines. If your avocado starts looking like a pear, you can add bumps and make it lumpier.

steps.title: Color it dark green with watercolor or colored pencils.
steps.content: Color it dark green with watercolor or colored pencils. You will need a really dark green that could almost look black. This gives it a more avocado-ish look to it. If you want to, you can add a stem, but it isn’t mandatory as it may let the avocado look like a pear if not done correctly.

steps.title: Draw two overlapping circles.
steps.content: Draw two overlapping circles. This is the same outline as drawing a whole avocado, but instead it's only half of an avocado.

steps.title: Connect the two circles.
steps.content: Connect the two circles. Now that you have an outline of an avocado, you can begin erasing any excess lines.

steps.title: Draw the round pit.
steps.content: Draw the round pit. This is the easiest part, because there's no erasing the pit.

steps.title: Draw a large raindrop shape around the circle.
steps.content: Draw a large raindrop shape around the circle. This is the ripe, yellowish green meat of the avocado.

steps.title: Sketch in the bumpy skin of the avocado.
steps.content: Sketch in the bumpy skin of the avocado. This would be colored in a dark forest green.

steps.title: Paint the colors in.
steps.content: Paint the colors in. The pit should be a dark orange color, with the meat a lime/yellow. Fade the lime into a dark green, and voilà, an avocado!

steps.title: Draw a rounded raindrop shape.
steps.content: Draw a rounded raindrop shape. Since it's a simple, cute avocado, there's no need for fancy sketching. Just be careful and slow while drawing the outline.

steps.title: Draw the pit seed.
steps.content: Draw the pit seed. A simple circle will do, just nothing too big.

steps.title: Draw two small circles for eyes.
steps.content: Draw two small circles for eyes. You can draw whatever face you like, but this is just an idea. You can put on eyelashes, or even a little mouth. You can add a little bow to it, add a purse, you can even add sunglasses. Whatever you like!

steps.title: Add color.
steps.content: Add color. You can use markers or watercolors. Any one you prefer.

steps.title: Draw a bowl.
steps.content: Draw a bowl. You can draw any bowl you prefer, but the simplest one looks like a smiley face with a line over it.

steps.title: Draw some mush in there.
steps.content: Draw some mush in there. Guacamole is basically squished avocados, right? Make it mushy, then add some little squares. Draw a couple of herbs/vegetables in there like cilantro, onions, and basil.

steps.title: Color the bowl.
steps.content: Color the bowl. This part is easy. It can be a fancy mexican bowl with beautiful patterns and drawings on it, or it can be a plain black bowl. Any way you prefer.

steps.title: Color in the guacamole.
steps.content: Color in the guacamole. Lime would be the best color. (You can use other colors, but it wouldn't really look like guacamole anymore.) Color the tomatoes with red and the herb leafs a dark green. Add black specks of pepper in for detail.

steps.title: Add in a pile of tortilla chips.
steps.content: Add in a pile of tortilla chips. Draw triangles, and little squares. Color it in a beige/tan. Cover it with little brown specks.
